## 🎯 Overview

BZ-Data is a comprehensive analytics platform for exploring and analyzing FX modality data across financial institutions. Built with modern data science tools, it provides interactive visualizations, statistical analysis, and real-time dashboards.

## 🚀 Features

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### 🏦 FI Analysis
Institution-specific deep dives with:

- Interactive time series across all modalities
- Comparative analysis and rankings
- Trend detection with moving averages
- Summary statistics and distributions
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### 📊 Exploratory Data Analysis
Modality-specific insights including:

- Distribution analysis and density plots
- Correlation matrices
- Temporal pattern detection
- Institution breakdowns
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### 📱 Interactive Dashboard
Shiny application featuring:

- Real-time filtering and date ranges
- Downloadable reports
- Value boxes with key metrics
- Interactive plotly visualizations
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-6}
### 📖 Data Dictionary
Complete documentation with:

- Schema definitions
- Variable descriptions
- Data quality metrics
- Validation rules
:::

:::

## 📈 Quick Stats

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
library(dplyr)
library(scales)

source("R/data_loader.R")
df <- load_fx_data()

total_records <- nrow(df)
total_volume <- sum(df$value, na.rm = TRUE)
institutions <- length(unique(df$institution))
modalities <- length(unique(df$modality))
date_range <- paste(min(df$date), "to", max(df$date))
```

## 🛠️ Getting Started

### View the Analysis

Simply navigate through the pages using the menu above. All visualizations are interactive - hover for details, zoom, and pan.

### Run Locally

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/fhansen315/BZ-Data.git
cd BZ-Data

# Install dependencies
make install

# Preview the site
make preview

# Run Shiny dashboard
make shiny
```

### Load Your Data

Place your data file in `data/raw/` and set the environment variable:

```bash
export BZ_DATA_PATH="data/raw/your_file.csv"
```

Expected columns: `date`, `institution`, `modality`, `value`
